# Method Comparison

## Type I Error, LMM

```{r, compare-all-lmm-typeI, echo = FALSE, message = FALSE, warning = FALSE, fig.height = 10, fig.cap = "Methods by Type I Error for all Linear Mixed Models separated by model and estimated vs. theoretical residuals. Colors represent the type of test used to evaluate the residuals"}

histogram.err(df = pvals, Type = "LMM")

```

## Type I Error, GLMM

```{r, compare-all-glmm-typeI, echo = FALSE, message = FALSE, warning = FALSE, fig.height = 10, fig.cap = "Methods by Type I Error for all Generalized Linear Mixed Models separated by model and estimated vs. theoretical residuals. Colors represent the type of test used to evaluate the residuals"}

histogram.err(df = pvals, Type = "LMM")

```

```{r, compare-all-lmm-power, echo = FALSE, message = FALSE, warning = FALSE, fig.height = 10, fig.cap = "Methods by Power for all Linear Mixed Models separated by model and estimated vs. theoretical residuals. Colors represent the type of test used to evaluate the residuals"}

```{r, compare-all-glmm-power, echo = FALSE, message = FALSE, warning = FALSE, fig.height = 10, fig.cap = "Methods by Power for all Generalized Linear Mixed Models separated by model and estimated vs. theoretical residuals. Colors represent the type of test used to evaluate the residuals"}

## LMM, theoretical residuals

```{r, compare-all-lmm-theoretical, echo = FALSE, message = FALSE, warning = FALSE, fig.height = 10, fig.cap = "Methods by Type I Error (top row) and Power (rows 2-7) calculated with estiamted residuals for all Linear Mixed Models separated by model and mis-specification. The top row represents theoretical Type I error under the correct model. Colors represent the type of test used to evaluate the residuals"}

histogram.err.pow(df = pvals, Type = "LMM", ResType = TRUE )

```

## LMM, estimated residuals

```{r, compare-all-lmm-estimated, echo = FALSE, message = FALSE, warning = FALSE, fig.height = 10, fig.cap = "Methods by Type I Error (top row) and Power (rows 2-7) calculated with estiamted residuals for all Linear Mixed Models separated by model and mis-specification. ```
